intro: Kayea garciae, commonly known as the Garcia's kayea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Kayea garciae is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its habitat.
